intro: Myxopappus, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, dandelion-like yellow flowers and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. The plants typically have hairy leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss in dry environments. Myxopappus species are often found in disturbed soils and are adapted to survive in harsh, drought-prone conditions. They play a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in their native habitats.
